00032 class NiSourceTexture : public Named
00033 {
00034 public:
00035 
00036   // Is this an external (references a separate texture file) or
00037   // internal (data is inside the nif itself) texture?
00038   bool external;
00039 
00040   SString filename;    // In case of external textures
00041   NiPixelDataPtr data; // In case of internal textures
00042 
00043   /* Pixel layout
00044      0 - Palettised
00045      1 - High color 16
00046      2 - True color 32
00047      3 - Compressed
00048      4 - Bumpmap
00049      5 - Default */
00050   int pixel;
00051 
00052   /* Mipmap format
00053      0 - no
00054      1 - yes
00055      2 - default */
00056   int mipmap;
00057 
00058   /* Alpha
00059      0 - none
00060      1 - binary
00061      2 - smooth
00062      3 - default (use material alpha, or multiply material with texture if present)
00063   */
00064   int alpha;
00065 
00066   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00067   {
00068     Named::read(nif);
00069 
00070     external = !!nif->getByte();
00071 
00072     if(external) filename = nif->getString();
00073     else
00074       {
00075         nif->getByte(); // always 1
00076         data.read(nif);
00077       }
00078 
00079     pixel = nif->getInt();
00080     mipmap = nif->getInt();
00081     alpha = nif->getInt();
00082 
00083     nif->getByte(); // always 1
00084   }
00085 };
00086 
00087 // Common ancestor for several data classes
00088 class ShapeData : public Record
00089 {
00090 public:
00091   FloatArray vertices, normals, colors, uvlist;
00092   const Vector *center;
00093   float radius;
00094 
00095   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00096   {
00097     int verts = nif->getShort();
00098 
00099     if(nif->getInt())
00100       vertices = nif->getFloatLen(verts*3);
00101 
00102     if(nif->getInt())
00103       normals = nif->getFloatLen(verts*3);
00104 
00105     center = nif->getVector();
00106     radius = nif->getFloat();
00107 
00108     if(nif->getInt())
00109       colors = nif->getFloatLen(verts*4);
00110 
00111     int uvs = nif->getShort();
00112 
00113     // Only the first 6 bits are used as a count. I think the rest are
00114     // flags of some sort.
00115     uvs &= 0x3f;
00116 
00117     if(nif->getInt())
00118       uvlist = nif->getFloatLen(uvs*verts*2);
00119   }
00120 };
00121 
00122 class NiTriShapeData : public ShapeData
00123 {
00124 public:
00125   // Triangles, three vertex indices per triangle
00126   SliceArray<short> triangles;
00127 
00128   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00129   {
00130     ShapeData::read(nif);
00131 
00132     int tris = nif->getShort();
00133     if(tris)
00134       {
00135         // We have three times as many vertices as triangles, so this
00136         // is always equal to tris*3.
00137         int cnt = nif->getInt();
00138         triangles = nif->getArrayLen<short>(cnt);
00139       }
00140 
00141     // Read the match list, which lists the vertices that are equal to
00142     // vertices. We don't actually need need this for anything, so
00143     // just skip it.
00144     int verts = nif->getShort();
00145     if(verts)
00146       {
00147         for(int i=0;i<verts;i++)
00148           {
00149             // Number of vertices matching vertex 'i'
00150             short num = nif->getShort();
00151             nif->skip(num*sizeof(short));
00152           }
00153       }
00154   }
00155 };
00156 
00157 class NiAutoNormalParticlesData : public ShapeData
00158 {
00159 public:
00160   int activeCount;
00161 
00162   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00163   {
00164     ShapeData::read(nif);
00165 
00166     // Should always match the number of vertices
00167     activeCount = nif->getShort();
00168 
00169     // Skip all the info, we don't support particles yet
00170     nif->getFloat();  // Active radius ?
00171     nif->getShort(); // Number of valid entries in the following arrays ?
00172 
00173     if(nif->getInt())
00174       // Particle sizes
00175       nif->getFloatLen(activeCount);
00176   }
00177 };
00178 
00179 class NiRotatingParticlesData : public NiAutoNormalParticlesData
00180 {
00181 public:
00182   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00183   {
00184     NiAutoNormalParticlesData::read(nif);
00185 
00186     if(nif->getInt())
00187       // Rotation quaternions. I THINK activeCount is correct here,
00188       // but verts (vertex number) might also be correct, if there is
00189       // any case where the two don't match.
00190       nif->getArrayLen<Vector4>(activeCount);
00191   }
00192 };

00194 class NiPosData : public Record
00195 {
00196 public:
00197   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00198   {
00199     int count = nif->getInt();
00200     int type = nif->getInt();
00201     if(type != 1 && type != 2)
00202       nif->fail("Cannot handle NiPosData type");
00203 
00204     // TODO: Could make structs of these. Seems to be identical to
00205     // translation in NiKeyframeData.
00206     for(int i=0; i<count; i++)
00207       {
00208         /*float time =*/ nif->getFloat();
00209         nif->getVector(); // This isn't really shared between type 1
00210                           // and type 2, most likely
00211         if(type == 2)
00212           {
00213             nif->getVector();
00214             nif->getVector();
00215           }
00216       }
00217   }
00218 };
00219 
00220 class NiUVData : public Record
00221 {
00222 public:
00223   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00224   {
00225     // TODO: This is claimed to be a "float animation key", which is
00226     // also used in FloatData and KeyframeData. We could probably
00227     // reuse and refactor a lot of this if we actually use it at some
00228     // point.
00229 
00230     for(int i=0; i<2; i++)
00231       {
00232         int count = nif->getInt();
00233 
00234         if(count)
00235           {
00236             nif->getInt(); // always 2
00237             nif->getArrayLen<Vector4>(count); // Really one time float + one vector
00238           }
00239       }
00240     // Always 0
00241     nif->getInt();
00242     nif->getInt();
00243   }
00244 };
00245

00247 {

00249   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00250   {
00251     int count = nif->getInt();
00252     nif->getInt(); // always 2
00253     nif->getArrayLen<Vector4>(count); // Really one time float + one vector
00254   }

00257 class NiPixelData : public Record
00258 {
00259 public:
00260   unsigned int rmask, gmask, bmask, amask;
00261   int bpp, mips;
00262 
00263   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00264   {
00265     nif->getInt(); // always 0 or 1
00266 
00267     rmask = nif->getInt(); // usually 0xff
00268     gmask = nif->getInt(); // usually 0xff00
00269     bmask = nif->getInt(); // usually 0xff0000
00270     amask = nif->getInt(); // usually 0xff000000 or zero
00271 
00272     bpp = nif->getInt();
00273 
00274     // Unknown
00275     nif->skip(12);
00276 
00277     mips = nif->getInt();
00278 
00279     // Bytes per pixel, should be bpp * 8
00280     /*int bytes =*/ nif->getInt();
00281 
00282     for(int i=0; i<mips; i++)
00283       {
00284         // Image size and offset in the following data field
00285         /*int x =*/ nif->getInt();
00286         /*int y =*/ nif->getInt();
00287         /*int offset =*/ nif->getInt();
00288       }
00289 
00290     // Skip the data
00291     unsigned int dataSize = nif->getInt();
00292     nif->skip(dataSize);
00293   }
00294 };
00295 
00296 class NiColorData : public Record
00297 {
00298 public:
00299   struct ColorData
00300   {
00301     float time;
00302     Vector4 rgba;
00303   };
00304 
00305   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00306   {
00307     int count = nif->getInt();
00308     nif->getInt(); // always 1
00309 
00310     // Skip the data
00311     assert(sizeof(ColorData) == 4*5);
00312     nif->skip(sizeof(ColorData) * count);
00313   }
00314 };
00315 
00316 class NiVisData : public Record
00317 {
00318 public:
00319   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00320   {
00321     int count = nif->getInt();
00322     /*
00323       Each VisData consists of:
00324         float time;
00325         byte isSet;
00326 
00327       If you implement this, make sure you use a packed struct
00328       (sizeof==5), or read each element individually.
00329      */
00330     nif->skip(count*5);
00331   }
00332 };

00334 class NiSkinInstance : public Record
00335 {
00336 public:
00337   NiSkinDataPtr data;
00338   NodePtr root;
00339   NodeList bones;
00340 
00341   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00342   {
00343     data.read(nif);
00344     root.read(nif);
00345     bones.read(nif);
00346 
00347     if(data.empty() || root.empty())
00348       nif->fail("NiSkinInstance missing root or data");
00349   }
00350 
00351   void post(NIFFile *nif);
00352 };

00354 class NiSkinData : public Record
00355 {
00356 public:
00357   // This is to make sure the structs are packed, ie. that the
00358   // compiler doesn't mess them up with extra alignment bytes.
00359 #pragma pack(push)
00360 #pragma pack(1)
00361 
00362   struct BoneTrafo
00363   {
00364     Matrix rotation; // Rotation offset from bone?
00365     Vector trans;    // Translation
00366     float scale;     // Probably scale (always 1)
00367   };
00368 
00369   struct VertWeight
00370   {
00371     short vertex;
00372     float weight;
00373   };
00374 #pragma pack(pop)
00375 
00376   struct BoneInfo
00377   {
00378     const BoneTrafo *trafo;
00379     const Vector4 *unknown;
00380     SliceArray<VertWeight> weights;
00381   };
00382 
00383   const BoneTrafo *trafo;
00384   std::vector<BoneInfo> bones;
00385 
00386   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00387   {
00388     assert(sizeof(BoneTrafo) == 4*(9+3+1));
00389     assert(sizeof(VertWeight) == 6);
00390 
00391     trafo = nif->getPtr<BoneTrafo>();
00392 
00393     int boneNum = nif->getInt();
00394     nif->getInt(); // -1
00395 
00396     bones.resize(boneNum);
00397 
00398     for(int i=0;i<boneNum;i++)
00399       {
00400         BoneInfo &bi = bones[i];
00401 
00402         bi.trafo = nif->getPtr<BoneTrafo>();
00403         bi.unknown = nif->getVector4();
00404 
00405         // Number of vertex weights
00406         int count = nif->getShort();
00407         bi.weights = nif->getArrayLen<VertWeight>(count);
00408       }
00409   }
00410 };
00411 
00412 class NiMorphData : public Record
00413 {
00414 public:
00415   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00416   {
00417     int morphCount = nif->getInt();
00418     int vertCount  = nif->getInt();
00419     nif->getByte();
00420 
00421     for(int i=0; i<morphCount; i++)
00422       {
00423         int magic = nif->getInt();
00424         nif->getInt();
00425         if(magic)
00426           // Time, data, forward, backward tangents
00427           nif->getFloatLen(4*magic);
00428 
00429         nif->getFloatLen(vertCount*3);
00430       }
00431   }
00432 };
00433 
00434 class NiKeyframeData : public Record
00435 {
00436 public:
00437   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00438   {
00439     // Rotations first
00440     int count = nif->getInt();
00441     if(count)
00442       {
00443         int type = nif->getInt();
00444 
00445         if(type == 1)
00446           nif->skip(count*4*5); // time + quaternion
00447         else if(type == 3)
00448           nif->skip(count*4*8); // rot1 + tension+bias+continuity
00449         else if(type == 4)
00450           {
00451             for(int j=0;j<count;j++)
00452               {
00453                 nif->getFloat(); // time
00454                 for(int i=0; i<3; i++)
00455                   {
00456                     int cnt = nif->getInt();
00457                     int type = nif->getInt();
00458                     if(type == 1)
00459                       nif->skip(cnt*4*2); // time + unknown
00460                     else if(type == 2)
00461                       nif->skip(cnt*4*4); // time + unknown vector
00462                     else nif->fail("Unknown sub-rotation type");
00463                   }
00464               }
00465           }
00466         else nif->fail("Unknown rotation type in NiKeyframeData");
00467       }
00468 
00469     // Then translation
00470     count = nif->getInt();
00471     if(count)
00472       {
00473         int type = nif->getInt();
00474 
00475         if(type == 1) nif->getFloatLen(count*4); // time + translation
00476         else if(type == 2)
00477           nif->getFloatLen(count*10); // trans1 + forward + backward
00478         else if(type == 3)
00479           nif->getFloatLen(count*7); // trans1 + tension,bias,continuity
00480         else nif->fail("Unknown translation type");
00481       }
00482 
00483     // Finally, scalings
00484     count = nif->getInt();
00485     if(count)
00486       {
00487         int type = nif->getInt();
00488 
00489         int size = 0;
00490         if(type == 1) size = 2; // time+scale
00491         else if(type == 2) size = 4; // 1 + forward + backward (floats)
00492         else if(type == 3) size = 5; // 1 + tbc
00493         else nif->fail("Unknown scaling type");
00494         nif->getFloatLen(count*size);
00495       }
00496   }
00497 };
